Diagnosis. A smaLL TO mEdIUm sIzEd spECIEs wITH vEry sHOrT R2 aNd R3, R2 HavING TypICaL
Metalycaeus
- TypE rIbs aNd R3 LaCkING swELLING.

Description of typical
muciferus
.
SHELL ( FIGUrE 58A ) wHITE; sHELL OUTLINE sLIGHTLy OvaL frOm dOrsaL vIEw, spIrE sLIGHTLy ELEvaTEd, EdGE Of bOdy wHOrL rOUNdEd; prOTOCONCH ( FIGUrEs 61C–D ) CONspICUOUsLy ELEvaTEd frOm dOrsaL sUrfaCE, CONsIsTING Of 1.75 wHOrLs (N = 2), raTHEr maTTE, ITs ENd wITH INCONspICUOUs spIraL sTrIaTIONs; R1 CONsIsTs Of 1.5–1.75 wHOrLs, wITH IrrEGULar, wIdELy-spaCEd rIbs aNd fINE spIraL sCULpTUrE; rIbs sLIGHTLy bECOmING mOrE wIdELyspaCEd TOwards ENd Of R1; TraNsITION bETwEEN R1 aNd R2 NOT CONspICUOUs; R2 wITH dENsE, sHarp, ELEvaTEd rIbs ( FIGUrEs 60E–F ); CrOss sECTION Of rIbs Of TypICaL
muciferus
COULd NOT bE ExamINEd (bUT sEE rEmarks); LENGTH Of R2 aNd R3 vEry sLIGHTLy mOrE THaN a qUarTEr wHOrL COmbINEd (apprOxImaTELy 100 dEGrEEs); R2 LONGEr THaN R3; TraNsITION bETwEEN R2 aNd R3 raTHEr smOOTH, NO CONsTrICTION vIsIbLE; R3 wITH fEw wIdELy-spaCEd wrINkLEs, apErTUrE aLmOsT ExaCTLy rOUNdEd; OUTEr LIp vEry HIGH aNd sHarp, sIGNIfICaNTLy ExpaNdEd aNd sLIGHTLy rEfLECTEd; INNEr LIp sLIGHTLy THICkENEd, NOT CONspICUOUs; bOUNdary bETwEEN TwO LIps HardLy vIsIbLE.
Measurements (in mm). D = 3.3–5.3, H = 2.1–3.4 (N = 18, spECImENs frOm dIffErENT LOCaLITIEs). SEE aLsO TabLE 5 .

Operculum. THE OUTEr sUrfaCE Of THE OpErCULUm Of THE TypE sErIEs Of
muciferus
aNd
helicodes
wErE COvErEd by mUd. UNdEr THE mUd, HOwEvEr, aN ELEvaTEd, mULTIspIraL, wrINkLEd LamELLa was vIsIbLE. BOTH sIdEs Of THE OpErCULUm Of sampLE 20081113 B wErE ExamINEd. THE OUTEr sUrfaCE sHOwEd mULTIspIraL CHaraCTEr wITHOUT ELEvaTEd LamELLa; THE INNEr sIdE Had a vEry smaLL, LOw CENTraL NIppLE sITTING ON THE TOp Of a GradUaLLy ELEvaTEd " HILL ".

Variation in specimens.
Metalycaeus muciferus Is
a vEry varIabLE spECIEs IN sHELL sIzE, sHELL sCULpTUrE aNd COLOUr. TabLE 5 COmpILEs THE varIabLE TraITs aNd THEIr CHaraCTEr sTaTEs IN ExamINEd pOpULaTIONs.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 58. Shells of
Metalycaeus muciferus
(Heude, 1885)
. A. syntype. B. 20070714B, coll. PGB. C. 2011/15, coll. HA. D. 2015/48, coll. HA. Note that the black "operculum" of Fig. D is the posterior end of a predator fly larva. Scale represents 5 mm. All photos: B. Páll-Gergely.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Differential diagnosis.
Metalycaeus muciferus
CaN bE dIsTINGUIsHEd frOm OTHEr
Metalycaeus
spECIEs ON THE basIs Of THE sHOrT R2, aNd THE aLsO sHOrT R3, wHICH LaCks a swELLING IN ITs mIddLE. SEE UNdEr
Dicharax bison
n. sp.
,
Metalycaeus heudei
,
M. laosensis
n. sp.
,
M. oharai
n. sp.
aNd
M. latecostatus
.
Distribution. SHELLs assIGNEd TO THIs spECIEs wErE COLLECTEd frOm mULTIpLE CHINEsE prOvINCEs ( YUNNaN , GUaNGxI , HUNaN , HUbEI , SICHUaN , CHONGqING , GUIzHOU ) aNd NOrTHErN VIETNam ( FIGUrE 57 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. TypICaL
Metalycaeus muciferus
( FIGUrE 58A ) aNd
M. helicodes
(FIGUrE 59B) spECImENs aGrEE IN THE fOLLOwING TraITs: bOTH R2 aNd R3 arE vEry sHOrT; THErE Is NO rECOGNIsabLE CONsTrICTION aT THE bOrdEr Of THE TwO rEGIONs; THE rIbs ON R2 arE wIdELy-spaCEd aNd sHarp; pErIsTOmE rELaTIvELy THIN (aLTHOUGH sOmETImEs ExpaNdEd). WE ExamINEd a NUmbEr Of NEwLy COLLECTEd CHINEsE sampLEs, wHICH aGrEE wITH
M. muciferus
aNd
M. helicodes
IN THE abOvE mENTIONEd TraITs, aLTHOUGH sHOw dIffErENCEs IN TErms Of spIrE HEIGHT, sCULpTUrE Of R1 aNd sIzE (sEE TabLE 5 aNd FIGUrEs 58 –59). NEarLy EvEry sINGLE pOpULaTION wE ExamINEd Has CHaraCTErIsTIC fEaTUrEs, wHICH aLLOws dIsTINGUIsHING IT frOm OTHErs. THEsE dIffErENCEs arE raTHEr mINOr. MOrEOvEr, THEsE sampLEs arE smaLL aNd maINLy CONTaIN wEaTHErEd sHELLs wITHOUT OpErCULa. THErEfOrE wE dO NOT fINd IT rEasONabLE TO dEsCrIbE THEm fOrmaLLy. INsTEad, UNTIL mOrE maTErIaL bECOmEs avaILabLE, wE LIsT aLL THEsE sampLEs aNd HaNdLE THEm UNdEr a sINGLE NamE (
Metalycaeus muciferus
).

THE CrOss sECTION Of R2 was ExamINEd IN ONE spECImEN Of THE pOpULaTION 2015/48 ( FIGUrE 61D ). ANTErIOr pLaTE raTHEr sTraIGHT, HOLLOw, IT Has a LOw, bUT sHarp rIb; pOsTErIOr CrUsT sTrONG, ONLy sLIGHTLy LOwEr THaN THE aNTErIOr ONE ; THE mICrOTUNNEL Has a TEardrOp-sHapEd CrOss sECTION, ITs dIamETEr Is CONspICUOUsLy LarGE IN rELaTION TO THE sIzE Of THE CrUsTs. THE aNTErIOr CrUsT Of TypICaL
muciferus
sHELLs Is HOLLOw. SEE aLsO rEmarks UNdEr
Alycaeus dolichodeiros
.
